attributes.action: Yorkshire to secede from the U.K. and become part of Scotland.
attributes.background: We have more in common with our Northern brothers and sisters than southern Tory counties. We wish to join Scotland and remain part of the E.U. and have free prescriptions and university education.

attributes.action: Change the HWC to make it an offence to park opposite/within 10m of a junction.
attributes.background: The HWC states (rule 243) DO NOT stop or park opposite or within 10 metres of a junction, except in an authorised parking space, however as this is just an advisory it is ignored by many drivers across the UK. This should be changed to MUST NOT meaning tickets can be issued by traffic wardens.

attributes.action: Overlook parents income for getting a student loan
attributes.background: When applying for a student loan you have to give your parents financial information even if they do not support you financially, meaning a lot of people get given the minimum for student finance and then have to struggle for the year. Change this so that it looks at your own financial situation.
attributes.additional_details: Student finance bases your loan on how much your parents make, but just because they make that doesn't mean they give it to you. A lot of people support themselves but cannot be given more help due to parents. Change the rules on applying to just look at the students income and financial situation.

attributes.action: Government should underwrite car insurance for young first time drivers.
attributes.background: For young drivers, the average cost of getting on the road has increased by 18% over the last 5 years to almost £6,800. Car insurance makes up a third of the total. This makes it prohibitively expensive for many average income families.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that the government should explore a government backed insurance scheme for young drivers there by offering a fair opportunity to all regardless of family income

attributes.action: Allow local councils to keep 100% of Right to Buy receipts.
attributes.background: Under current regulations, councils in England are entitled to pay for 30% of the cost of replacing social housing with funds from the sale of Right to Buy properties. This means that, for every £1 of receipts they keep, they need to raise another £2.30 through loans.
attributes.additional_details:
The sale of social housing through the Right to Buy scheme could have been a good way for local councils to raise much-needed cash to build more homes. Unfortunately, the majority of it has ended up with central government as councils can't find the amounts of money needed to keep the receipts.
We are all well aware of the damage a shortage of available social housing has done and this change would allow the increase in home building that we so desperately need.

attributes.action: Ban Diesel Vehicles from City Centers
attributes.background:
This Monday pollution levels in areas of the UK were higher than in parts of Beijing, China.

Diesel vehicles produce 80% of this pollution and cars produce 10x the same pollution from trucks and busses.

I call upon the government to introduce a ban on these vehicles from city centers.
attributes.additional_details:
The ban should be implemented by 2018 as part of the government plan to fight pollution due in April.

The fine should be 10x the current value of the car tax for that vehicle class plus interest. Considerations should be made for the age of the vehicle and the level of pollution so that dirtier cars are more heavily penalised.

 Buses should be mandated to be petrol hybrid or electric and trucks may have an exemption during off-peak hours but companies should be forced to pay an emissions tax.

attributes.action: Make the government provide the funding that the NHS and social care need
attributes.background: The NHS and social care under the conservatives has taken huge cuts. This has put huge strain on the NHS with the Red Cross deeming it a "humanitarian crisis". People are dying waiting on trolleys in hospital for beds that are not available.
attributes.additional_details: People are waiting up to 12 hours to be seen in A&E, when the target is four hours. Old people spend weeks in hospital beds as there is no social care to treat them at home. People's lives are at risk and the conservative government are doing nothing about it. I hearby call that PM Theresa May and health secretary Jeremy Hunt provide the funding that is desperately needed. This demands action and it needs it now. We cannot put people's lives at risk, this is not acceptable. They must act now.

attributes.action: Debate whether filibustering is acceptable in a modern democracy.
attributes.background:
There have been examples recently of filibustering. Here an individual takes it upon themselves to talk a bill out of debate.
This is an affront to democracy, as one individual should not have the power to decide what is or is not deemed acceptable to vote on.

attributes.action: BLUE BADGES SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PEOPLE WHO ARE AUTISTIC
attributes.background: AUTISM SHOULD BE AN ELIGIBLE DISABILITY FOR A BLUE BADGE

attributes.action: Ban the sale to, and possession by, civilians of combat daggers and bayonets.
attributes.background: These weapons' sole function is to kill - they can have no place in civilian ownership and yet are legally available to any UK adult. This is a legal loophole which could be easily closed.
attributes.additional_details: I am a secondary school teacher and work in the Security industry.

attributes.action: Don’t trigger Article 50 – just leave
attributes.background: Under international law and under Article 50 (1) itself, only notice to leave is necessary.
attributes.additional_details: if Article 50(2) is ‘triggered’ it implies that the UK government accepts that the EU will decide the conditions of UK’s withdrawal. This has serious consequences. An arbitrary two-year negotiation window; a supreme agency problem between negotiating parties. All the while we will be contributing approximately £40bn gross, or £20bn net, to the European project.

attributes.action: Get teachers in ALL schools more training on teaching kids with disabilities
attributes.background: My brother has autism spectrum disorder and went to many mainstream schools. He was bullied and taken advantage of by the kids and teachers never understood his meltdowns, having to come and get me. I think that ALL teachers, need to be trained and qualified on how to teach ALL types of children.
attributes.additional_details: Teaching kids, teenagers and adults with disabilities isn't rocket science. It just takes a bit of training and a lot of patience. Not only would it be great for the teachers to be able to teach both neurotypical and disabled children, but it would also help the children, they would feel more socially accepted and not put down by a disability they can't help thenselves having (or, as I see it, a gift too special for people to handle). Please help raise awareness and maybe get training in place.

attributes.action: Clearly define to Donald Trump what behaviour would end our special relationship
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand a debate in parliament to clearly define, both to the UK and US governments, what behaviour by the new US President-elect in office would result in the British people demanding the end of the UK-US special relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The UK-US special relationship has been built on shared values, objectives & defence over many years. We the undersigned want the special relationship to continue but it can only be special if those values, objectives & defence are still shared. Donald Trump has been democratically elected president of the US, having made remarks during his campaign that many in the UK do not agree with. It is not our place to interfere with who is US president, but we can decide how we respond to the choice.

attributes.action: Introduce law that all MPs attend parliament "regularly".
attributes.background: As a parent I am expected to ensure my child attends school "regularly".  This has recently been ruled to mean on every school day and for every minute of that day - no lateness - no leaving early.  I would like to see the same regulation applied to attendance of Parliament for MPs.

attributes.action: Accept all forms of student/child identification on public transport nationwide
attributes.background: Currently when buying a child fare on public transport you need to own a valid bus pass from the area you are travelling in. When young people travel on public transport in counties other than their own they are charged a full adult fare which can often be very expensive. This needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: Me and many other young people live close to the border between counties and often need to travel between these areas. When using public transport in counties other than our own we are denied of the local child fare and are forced to pay a full adult fare, which is very expensive, especially for a young person. It is ridiculous to deny a child of a reduced fare just because their bus pass is from the wrong county. All forms of bus passes should be accepted on public transport everywhere

attributes.action: We ask the UK Government to seek to remove Turkey from NATO
attributes.background: Turkey has a consistent record of failing to comply with the necessary Human Rights standards and has very clearly engaged in military actions against essential allies.  Its treatment of the Kurds is a particular example.  Its close relations with Russia render it a security hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is some of the evidence:

https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2017/country-chapters/turkey

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey

attributes.action: Allow the people a referendum on the potential abolition of the 'House of Lords'
attributes.background:
The EU referendum gave the UK electorate the chance to say no to 'unelected' & ‘out of touch with reality’ officialdom in Brussels.
Sadly we have the same ‘unelected’ & ‘out of touch with reality’ membership of a club, numbering around 800, collectively known as the ‘House of Lords’.
attributes.additional_details:
At vast annual expense to the tax payer it is believed that he net operating costs of the House of Lords in 2013-4 were £93.1m, this is approximately equivalent to £118k per Peer.

I would strongly recommend that the annual total cost of the House of Lords that would be saved by its abolition, should be given in its entirety to our Local Council Authorities to help towards the increasing costs of providing compassionate care and adequate supervision for our increasingly elderly population.

attributes.action: Discuss measures to increase notifiable disease vaccination uptake.
attributes.background: Most childhood diseases are preventable. The NHS strongly encourages parents to vaccinate via education. However, a small minority of parents refuse. With the number of susceptible children increasing, these diseases are returning, putting lives at risk. New tactics are required to increase uptake.
attributes.additional_details:
Other governments have intervened to increase uptake:
Australia - withholding childcare payments until vaccinated (tinyurl.com/jrk6ll5)
USA - specific vaccination requirements before attending school (tinyurl.com/zswec56)

Discussing and adopting similar approaches in addition to education should increase uptake. Exemptions on health grounds should also be considered.

MMR severe reactions: <1 in 1 million
Measles deaths: before 1980 - 2,600,000 per year, 2015 <135,000.
(tinyurl.com/y8szy8e)

attributes.action: Stop councils selling off hundreds of our school's playing fields ! #WeSayNO
attributes.background:
Please see TES article link below for shocking details and sign & share this petition #WeSayNo #EnoughIsEnough 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-councils-sell-hundreds-acres-school-playing-field-land

attributes.action: Give NHS hospitals the same 80% discount on business rates given to charities.
attributes.background: NHS trusts do not qualify for the same tax relief on business rates from which charities currently benefit, including some private hospitals. In many cases, these rates are set to rise, costing hospitals millions. The Dept of Health has no plans to provide additional funding to cover this.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/feb/15/government-urged-stop-tax-hikes-nhs-hospitals-business-rates

attributes.action: Make TA and Reserve service pensionable employment retrospectively.
attributes.background: Many thousands of men and women have sacrificed weekends and nights training and augmenting the regular forces as well as mobilisation to war zones. In some cases well over 20 or 30 years and in some cases more without any pension rights. Pensions should reflect there time in service.
attributes.additional_details: Northern Ireland, Bosnia, Irak, Afghanistan just for example.

attributes.action: Allow smoking pubs or smoking rooms in certain pubs.
attributes.background: I think landlords/lady's should be able to turn there pubs into smoking or non smoking pubs. As we know pubs are closing everyday and this I believe it due to the smoking ban. If we had both smoking and non smoking it then would be down to the individual which pub they decided to go in.
attributes.additional_details: From 2007 smoking was banned in all public houses. Since this has happened thousands of small family run pubs have been closed down and never reopened. Local communities are suffering through this and so are the owners of the pubs. Allowing a smoking room would be a great space to go for a cigarette allowing people who don't smoke to be well away from it, or make some pubs smoking (at a charge made by government) so that people then have a choice which pub to attend

attributes.action: Points removed by DVLA should be erased by insurance companies at the same time.
attributes.background: Insurance companies hold on to points which have been removed by the DVLA for an extra year and are pumping up the price of insurance or refusing insurance altogether. I believe this is legalised theft and totally unfair.
attributes.additional_details: On 21st December 2012, I got caught without insurance by a technicality: I believed that I was insured but had missed a payment,  unknown to me Ellephant Insurance cancelled it without telling me. My payday was the next day and I had plans to pay then anyway so I would have found out. As a result I got an in 10.  6 points which stay on the licence for 4 years pumping up car insurance by lots and lots of money. (I STILL BELIEVE IT WAS NOT MY FAULT).  So 4 years have passed and still my car insurance is sky high as all the insurance companies keep it on record and used it against us for an extra year. THIS IS WRONG! THIS MUST CHANGE NOW!

attributes.action: Unban Tyler, The Creator from entering the UK
attributes.background: The US rapper Tyler, the Creator says he has been banned from the UK because of the nature of his lyrics however i believe this is unjust. He should not have been banned for lyrics he wrote 6-7 years prior and i believe his ban should be lifted, however he hasn't written lyrics like that since.
attributes.additional_details:
The letter from the secretary of state for the home department at the time sated in a letter sent to Tyler that his lyrics “encourages violence and intolerance of homosexuality” 

His manager went into more detail on his Tumblr, saying 
more importantly, this is a broader issue of free speech, the letter acknowledged he was writing from an alter ego perspective does this then apply to book writers? What message does that send? is race a conscious or subconscious factor at all?

attributes.action: The UK Government must commit to publicly destroying all stockpiled ivory.
attributes.background: Between 2009 and 2014, 40% of all illegal wildlife seizures made by the UK’s Border Force were ivory items. In 2015, 110kg of ivory were captured at Heathrow airport in one of the UK’s largest seizures of illegal ivory. We call on the UK Government to commit to destroying any stockpiles of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly destroying ivory stockpiles will raise awareness that the $20bn annual illegal wildlife trade is the 4th largest global illegal activity. This action will send a clear message to the world that the UK will not tolerate illegal trafficking and commercial trade in any raw or worked ivory and that we support a near total ban on domestic ivory trade. Most importantly, it will emphasise to current and future generations that ivory is worthless unless it is on wild living elephants.

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share

attributes.action: Back into society and work schemes for survivors of sexual and domestic abuse
attributes.background: lots of centres do not receive enough funding for survivors of sexual/domestic abuse, leaving the victim vulnerable and alone. Often secluded and struggling to live. There are schemes in place to help offenders of such crimes to get back into society and working but no such scheme for victims.
attributes.additional_details: In the last few years the U.K has seen massive cuts to helplines and therapy centres that provide great help to victims of abuse. A scheme was introduced that helps offenders of such abuse get back into society and start working again after their sentence or provides skills and training in prisons. Unfortunately no such scheme is in place to help victims get back into socialising, learning new skills, being able to work and sometimes even keep their homes. This needs to change.

attributes.action: I want  to create a law to neuter domestic pets except for registered breeders.
attributes.background: Hundreds and thousands of pet animals are slaughtered as there are not enough homes. I have volunteered in pet rescue for  years and its now  worse as peoples lifestyle and priorities in 21st century have changed. Cruelty and neglect are commonplace. Reduce the numbers humanely stop them being born.
attributes.additional_details: Rescue centres are being swamped with unwanted pets They are turning away animals that vets are having to destroy just because they are no longer wanted or cannot be afforded  A law that all domestic animals are neutered unless bred by legislated breeders could stop the puppy farms, and cruelty and neglect by ignorance and greed of casual breeding, and these innocent creatures of all ages could have loving homes  Check the websites of animal charities to see the levels of neglect and euthanasia

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Urinary Tract Infections tested for and prescribed for by a pharmacist not a GP.
attributes.background: A UTI can be debilitating, testing and treatment at a pharmacy saves women the hassle of waiting for an appointment or call back from the GP for a prescription of antibiotics. It would save the NHS the cost and time of a GP testing and prescribing for a UTI.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with a UTI during NHS out of hours and had to travel (in pain) many miles for treatment. It can take 24 hours or more to receive treatment, much of which wastes NHS time and has caused myself and other women a great deal of distress. If I could be tested and treated solely at a pharmacy it would save many women time and pain and would save wasting GP time.

attributes.action: Give Police a power to seize vehicles of those caught driving & using mobiles
attributes.background: Following the jailing today of Tomasz Kroker for 10 years for causing the deaths of Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith, it's time this country toughened the law on using a mobile phone behind the wheel.
attributes.additional_details: Most people don't even think about it.  They answer a call, they write or read a text whilst driving, they change music tracks like Tomasz Kroker as he drove a heavy goods vehicle.  Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith were on their way back from a holiday when they were killed instantly.  You have probably seen the moving video of their relatives describing the aftermath.  Sign this petition in their memory & for radical change.

attributes.action: Screening and training for mobility scooters especially for class 3
attributes.background: There are 300,000 mobility users in England and Wales. There were 208 accidents in 2014-2015, 46 serious injuries, and 9 deaths. Class 3 mobility scooters can use the road up to 8mph, need TAX and at present, only voluntary insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Training is needed for cars and motorcycles that use the highways but no training is needed for mobility scooters. AM Hefin David and AM Julie Morgan are in agreement that training should be given. Compulsory training will help reduce accident rates and make the users more confident and independent which will help with well-being. Statistics are being looked into to make insurance mandatory but not training. ROSPA say training should be given but not necessary!

Screening should also be done by a doctor or medical professional before buying a mobility scooter. This will ensure that people have the physical and mental capacity required to safely use a scooter, such as adequate vision.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT on bottled water from 20% to 0% in crackdown on sugary drinks
attributes.background:
In the current health crack down on sugary drinks in the fight against obesity, what is the sense of VAT at 20% on bottled water while conceding 0% VAT on cake?
Silicawaters.com want VAT on bottled water zero rated in line with other EU countries like France which levies a rate of 5%.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason HMRC gives for imposing 20% VAT on bottled water is that it is a non-essential item, seeing as tap water in the UK is VAT free. While cake of course is essential eating! 
But in the health war on obesity and the forthcoming sugar tax on drinks, might it not be an incentive for parents, instead of a pricey bottle of pop, to send their children out with a trendy bottle of water, sensibly lowered  in price by a fifth for healthy living?
Help water down VAT on bottled water!

attributes.action: Blue Badge support for injuries causing short term paralysis and disabilities.
attributes.background: Following an injury or during recovery from surgery you may have limited mobility and so need some of the help a Blue Badge offers like access to disabled parking.  Currently anyone anyone with "temporary" conditions like this do not qualify.  A short term badge should be introduced.
attributes.additional_details: Follow an accident my leg was badly broken. The doctors were able to save my leg but I now have a frame holding it together.  I was rejected for a blue badge as i was told I could walk 100 meters on crutches. I had to appeal explaining that the frame was no guarantee I would recover and without it I would not be able to walk at all plus it's very painful. While in this condition I need access to disabled parking so I can open the car door fully when getting in and out.

attributes.action: Green badge for parent parking
attributes.background: Just like the blue badge for disabled parking. I am proposing a green badge for parent parking. This badge to be given with the bounty pack on the birth of you child with a 5 year expiry date. This is to ensure parent parking spaces are used for parents. Thank you for your help and support
attributes.additional_details:
We all see posts on Facebook of parents becoming upset over non parents parking in parent spaces. 
A simple badge system to ensure these spaces are used for those who really need them. 
These spaces do not need to be near the door of the shop it's the space that is needed. 
The green badge approach will ensure these spaces are used the way the should be.

attributes.action: Dangerous dogs that have re offended need to be euthanised immediately
attributes.background: Our fifteen year old daughter and our sixteen week old puppy were subjected to a vicious unprovoked attack near our home. The dog that carried out the attack has a previous history of this! The dog has not been destroyed and will only be if the court rule this! The dog is free to attack again
attributes.additional_details: During the attack our daughter suffered bite injuries to her elbow. This has caused her lots of pain and discomfort due to the nerves in that area. Had she not had a coat on it would have been a more significant injury and potentially limb threatening! Our puppy received surgery to save her badly broken leg and will require on going medical attention. The emotional scars will take years to heal for both of them! Our seven year old daughter who witnessed the attack is also deeply affected.

attributes.action: Fulfill your promise to 2.5 million tenants, give HA tenants Right to Buy now.
attributes.background: Government have promised to give Housing Association (HA) tenants Right to Buy a year ago. It is only fair HA tenants get equal rights as Council tenants. In my few that promise was the most vote wining promises in the Government manifesto. They owe it to the 2.5 million HA tenants to fulfill it now
attributes.additional_details: Government have promised to give Housing Association (HA) tenants Right to Buy a year ago. It is only fair HA tenants get equal rights as Council tenants. In my few that promise was the most vote wining promises in the Government manifesto. They owe it to the 2.5 million HA tenants to fulfill it now. It is fairness and equality issue to give HA tenants equal rights as Council tenants. FULFILL YOU PROMISE AND PLEDGE TO THE 2.5 MILLION HA TENANTS WHO VOTED FOR YOU. GIVE THEM RTB NOW.

attributes.action: Stop King George Hospital being downgraded to an urgent care centre.
attributes.background: Redbridge could be left without an accident and emergency unit if proposals go ahead – leaving 300,000 out of reach of emergency medical care.
attributes.additional_details: Under the North East London Sustainability and Transformation Plan (STP), the A&E at King George Hospital in Goodmayes, will be downgraded to an urgent care centre, with changes proposed to come into effect by summer 2019. Emergency cases in the borough will instead be taken to Queen's Hospital in Romford, in Havering, or Whipps Cross University Hospital, in Waltham Forest. Whipps Cross was rated as "inadequate" by the Care Quality Commission in December last year. Profit before Patients.

attributes.action: Postpone Article 50 until we know what Donald Trump is up to
attributes.background: This petition requests that the Government postpone triggering Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty until the implications of the new US President's plans become clear. President Trump is making major changes to the US foreign policy and it's far from clear that these will benefit British interests.
attributes.additional_details: Many commentators and British citizens fear the direction President Trump is taking his country. This petition recognises that the Government has committed to removing the United Kingdom from the European Union. It does not pass judgement on the merits of leaving the EU, but considers it unwise to devote resources to doing so until the relationship with the USA has become more settled.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to have carbohydrate content lists
attributes.background:
Diabetic children all over the Uk miss hot school meals as there's no legal requirement for school to have carb  contents for their meals. 
As a diabetic child, Riley (7) has to injection insulin every time he eats, the amount depends on the carbs he is about to eat. Without this info he cannot eat
attributes.additional_details:
As a type1 diabetic you must inject inject insulin with all food and drink for life, there is no cure, there is also no cause so it's unpreventable!
The amount you inject depends on the amount of carbohydrate you are about to eat.
At the minute there is no legal requirement for schools to have this information meaning children are missing out on a hot school meal.
I believe all schools in the uk should have a list of carbohydrate contents for each meal so our children can eat a healthy hot meal

attributes.action: primary schools to teach kids private parts are private, and don't keep secrets
attributes.background: help prevent child abuse, if children no from a young age that private parts are private an don't keep secret games this can help prevent child abuse no matter how much you trust the person who looks after your child you can never totally be sure, a lot of child abuse is done by a family member.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me an sign this petition an share it, I couldn't help some one who is very close to me but this might be able to help someone else !!

attributes.action: Fully regulate Counselling and Psychotherapy, to properly protect the public.
attributes.background:
Anyone can call themselves "counsellor" or "psychotherapist", even with no qualifications at all.

Such people are a potentially fatal danger to clients, yet are currently free to practise.

There are societies to belong to, accreditations to gain and registers to join, but all are optional.
attributes.additional_details:
Successive governments have promised to regulate counselling for over a decade, but none have done so.

The "Accredited Register" scheme was created in 2013, and is like "CORGI" for counsellors. It sets minimum standards of training, insurance etc. However, you don't have to join a register and clients do not necessarily even know of its existence.

Regulation would protect the titles "counsellor" and "psychotherapist" and prevent those who do not meet minimum safety standards from practising.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Make it legal that disabled people travelling in wheelchairs need a head rest
attributes.background: I would like to make it legal for all disabled people travelling in wheelchairs to have a head rest for safety reasons. All car seats now have head rests and children in car seats must have head/neck support so why discriminate a disabled person by not supplying them with head/neck support.
attributes.additional_details: Please help by signing this petition

attributes.action: Make the sale of non-approved spring traps illegal.
attributes.background:
At present it is only illegal to USE non-approved traps. 
The law should be extended to ban the SALE of any trap not approved under the Spring Traps Approval Order 2012.
attributes.additional_details:
The present loop-hole allows sellers to sell inferior imported traps that have not been type-approved by DEFRA. This causes unnecessary suffering as these inferior traps often maim rather than give an instant kill. 

These imports are undemining the businesses in the UK that manufacture the genuine approved products.

attributes.action: All food sold in the UK must be labelled with ingredients and allergens
attributes.background: Many people in the UK suffer from food allergies, not just intolerances. These can vary from mild to severe, including causing anaphylactic shock. Staff in cafes and stores will not always know the allergen information when asked and can get this wrong, causing a potentially dangerous situation.
attributes.additional_details: The law currently states that all foods sold in the UK must clearly state any of the most common 14 allergens present in the food or the staff selling/providing the food must have the allergy information to hand when asked for it by the consumer. Staff often won't have this information or get it wrong when asked, which is why this needs to be clearly shown so the consumer can make an informed decision for themselves, not rely on information from someone who is untrained.

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction

attributes.action: Debate if Parliament is adequately representing the 48% and moderate Leavers
attributes.background: Remainers accept the Referendum outcome, but many feel that this government's current hard Brexit policy does not represent the 48% who voted Remain and the moderate Leavers who hoped for a softer Brexit. We want Parliament to debate if the current proceedings truly represent The Will of the People.
attributes.additional_details: We voted to leave the EU but did not vote upon the terms of our exit, which were never debated during the run up to the referendum, only speculated upon. HM Government's current policy seeks to appeal to only a small number of ardent Leavers and does not represent the more moderate desires of Remainers, moderate Leavers and "Regrexiteers, who by many estimates now make up the majority of those who voted. We would ask HM Government to debate if the current policy suitably represents their wishes.

attributes.action: Make British colonial history a larger part of the national history curriculum
attributes.background: We propose that the national history curriculum does not currently promote the study of British colonial history, a defining period for Britain and its Commonwealth peers, to a suitable degree of depth. We seek a parliamentary debate on whether the national curriculum should be changed accordingly

attributes.action: Debate funding for social care and the inequalities it poses to the NHS budget
attributes.background: Iris Sibley is not alone. Yes this is an extreme case and is not the norm, but the notion of being stuck in a hospital bed (at a cost of £90,000-the equivalent to 90 weeks in a home) because social care cannot respond is not excuse for failing our older generation. We need a national discussion.
